TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The security protocol to use for an NSStream.

remarks.para: This value controls which security protocol an NSStream uses to transfer the data on the stream, from nothing, to a specific version of SSL or TLS, or best possible.
Transport Layer Security (TLS) and its predecessor, Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), are cryptographic protocols designed to provide communication security over streams.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel NegotiatedSsl = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the two parties should negotiate a protocol, and it should use the most secure socket protocol available between the client and the server.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Do not use any security protocol.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel SslV2 = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel SslV3 = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel TlsV1 = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype Foundation.NSStreamSocketSecurityLevel Unknown = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The protocol is not known (can only happen if you build using an old SDK and run on a new device, and you have set the setting to "negotiated" and then you read the value back).
